intro: Disaccanthus carinatus, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its unique, zigzagging stems that add an ornamental appeal. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Disaccanthus carinatus thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and indoor settings due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
